messages.message: Since we set the object detection and ocr engine upon creation, how would want change this for downstream application runs. Lets say they no longer want this ocr or object detection? Do they have to recreate the entire project?
they would have to delete and re-upload any documents for which they want to use the new OCR settings

I would think we could change that for the app itself since its the update to process files step itself in the flow. If should at least mention these settings are not allowed to be changed after setting

oh oops i misread your original message, you should be able to republish the app with the new OCR settings -> you could then run the new app to use the new settings

i realize that this is currently not the case though, since we only check changes to the class/field schema to determine whether to show the “Update app” button
Is there a way to modify it afterwards?
I do not see the option when editing the app
after the project has been created, you can modify the OCR settings by clicking on the gear icon
Ah yes so that is the screenshot above but when you go to update your app the gear cog goes away
Mine is greyed out

when you update your app, the OCR settings most recently saved are used

are you saying that you expect the gear icon to show up on this “Create/update app” page?
So i cannot change any ocr settings at any stage other than the create first modal that appears
the gif here shows how to change ocr settings for an existing project https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0516UPPMT3/p1696442381386949?thread_ts=1696441107.965469&cid=C0516UPPMT3
But its greyed out...
so how do you update it :slightly_smiling_face:
can you take a screenshot or screen recording? i don’t understand the issue you’re describing since it’s not grayed out for me
hmm now it is selectable on a new project but if you look at my screenshot its greyed out
but i think we still need an edit button after a project is created
but not sure how to get back the edit button on my first project since i created an app on it
Ah i figured i tout

i see, the difference between my project and your project is that i haven’t created an app for my project

and the bug is that we don’t show the settings button after an app has been created for that project

i added this bug to the ticket i created above
when you click the object detection button it greys the bottom
so when you click the object detection button it greys out the bottom and you have to unselect the object detect for it to reshow up
if you select object detection, you have to use “Microsoft OCR”, so that’s why that box becomes grayed out
okay but thats not user friendly :slightly_smiling_face:
you know that but i didnt :slightly_smiling_face:
cc @Weiming Wu
@Weiming Wu do you think it’s possible to add copy to explain the relationship between object detection and ocr engine?
Why does checkboxes have to be attached to the OCR engine?
or multi tables?
i dont get as checkbox is onyx and tables are form rec

Yeah we should add some copy text

Checkboxes moved to form recognizer because it’s more accurate
okay but form recognizer isnt apart of the ocr pods or is it?
isnt that an external call
Form recognizer requires a bunch of options, one of which is to have the OCR engine be marx (Microsoft)
Okay, i think we should consider different wording that if using object detection microsoft must be used

For now, I filed this: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/FLOW-7547

But we still have to determine what exactly we want to convey and the exact wording
